<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning and welcome to winter. </strong>Not to get all dark at the beginning of the newsletter, but technically it <em>is </em>the shortest day of the year, and here in New York we’ll get just 9 hours and 15 minutes of daylight today. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Which means that if you began watching <em>The</em> <em>Lord of the Rings </em>trilogy right before sunrise, it’d be dark again by the end of the third movie.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">—<em>Neal Freyman, Matty Merritt, Max Knoblauch</em></p>

But yesterday the senator </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-12-20/democrats-wrestle-with-where-to-cut-wish-list-to-satisfy-manchin?srnd=premium" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">detailed</a></span><span> some changes to the bill he’d support, reviving hopes that negotiations could resume in January.</span>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AVIATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/20/5g-rollout-top-concern-for-airlines-in-early-2022?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
The Dogfight Over Airports and Airwaves
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/20/5g-rollout-top-concern-for-airlines-in-early-2022?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="An airplane running into radio airwaves" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/2f91aea90d77f23630608b1f5042cdde654d065e-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Francis Scialabba </em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you had to guess the No. 1 worry for airline execs right now, what would you say? Omicron lowering holiday travel demand? Rude passengers refusing to mask up?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The answer, in fact, is not at all related to Covid: What the industry is most concerned about, Southwest CEO Gary Kelly told senators last week, is the arrival of a <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-12-20/airlines-amp-up-warnings-on-5g-service-see-risk-of-late-flights?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new 5G wireless service</a> from AT&T and Verizon on Jan. 5. The aviation sector has been arguing that this launch will interfere with key cockpit systems and lead to major disruptions for travelers in the new year.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>United Airlines CEO Scott Kirby said that the 5G rollout could delay, divert, or cancel ~4% of daily flights.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The trade group Airlines for America projected 5G-related delays will cost passengers $1.6 billion annually.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Why can’t 5G and cockpits get along?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Airline execs say 5G signals, which operate in a range of radio frequencies called the C-band, could mess with the cockpit systems that are used to track a plane’s altitude and help with landings in bad weather. So, in a situation where those systems are interfered with by 5G signals and dense fog rolls into Chicago, landings at O’Hare might be deemed unsafe, which would then wreak scheduling havoc across the country.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In response to these concerns, telecom leaders are playing the world’s smallest violin. Wireless companies paid at least $81 billion for the rights to this C-band, and they’re not going to let airline execs ruin their much-hyped push into next-gen wireless networks…<em>especially</em> when they consider those concerns unfounded.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“The aviation industry’s fearmongering relies on completely discredited information and deliberate distortions of fact,” Nick Ludlum, senior vice president at wireless trade group CTIA, said.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>telecom and aviation leaders are locked in high-stakes negotiations with the White House and regulators about a deal that would dim 5G signal power near airports. In the meantime, airlines are warily prepping for flight restrictions.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/us-school-closures-covid-omicron?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Classrooms Empty Out...Again
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The fourth-grade holiday party just isn't the same from your kitchen table. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The number of US public schools closing due to Covid this week <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-12-20/school-closings-surge-as-omicron-spreads-across-the-u-s?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hit 646</a>, an increase of 81% from the previous week, according to data service Burbio. The jump comes only days before most schools’ winter breaks were set to begin and as the highly contagious Omicron variant races across the country.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some experts and politicians are urging school districts to keep their doors open. They argue that virtual classrooms are more harmful to students than the risk of developing severe illness from Covid (Covid hospitalizations for school-age children has been 1-in-100,000 throughout the pandemic).</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>One report from McKinsey Insights found that online learning left students up to five months behind in math and four months behind in reading. And schools with a majority Black population suffered even more educational setbacks after pivoting to virtual classes.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Health officials are increasingly trying to avoid widespread quarantines for school children. Last Friday, the CDC endorsed a policy known as “<a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/12/17/us/politics/unvaccinated-children-covid-testing-cdc.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">test-to-stay</a>,” which aims to reduce classroom disruptions by allowing students exposed to Covid to get tested and return to school.—<em>MM</em></p>
</div>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/20/oracle-buys-cerner-in-usd28-billion-push-into-health-care?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Oracle Eyeing the Health Care Market Like
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/20/oracle-buys-cerner-in-usd28-billion-push-into-health-care?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Leonardo Dicaprio saying "I'm a doctor." " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=438 src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2021-12-21/image-d378213bac980eb631a4b32e720b15981b2f352e-245x160-gif/giphy(3).gif">

<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Leonardo Dicaprio saying " I'm a doctor." " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2021-12-21/image-d378213bac980eb631a4b32e720b15981b2f352e-245x160-gif/giphy(3).gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Giphy</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tech giant Oracle said it’s <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/oracle-to-pay-more-than-30-billion-for-cerner-11640006531?mod=hp_lista_pos1" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">paying $28.3 billion</a> to buy electronic medical records company Cerner, because hey, anything that makes paperwork less excruciating seems like a savvy business play in our book.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Oracle is known for being aggressive with acquisitions (it even rallied a group to try and buy TikTok last year), but Cerner is Oracle’s biggest purchase in its history. The deal is further evidence that health care is “on par with banking in terms of the importance to our future,” as cofounder Larry Ellison told analysts earlier this month.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In Cerner, Oracle will get the Klay Thompson of the electronic medical records market—a very influential player, but in second place behind Epic, which owns a 31% market share.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Big tech companies see a <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/12/20/technology/oracle-cerner-health-records.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">golden opportunity</a> in bringing the health care industry to the cloud, given its size (health care spending accounts for 20% of US GDP), and its old-school record-keeping process. A Mayo Clinic study cited by Oracle showed that doctors and nurses spend an average of 1–2 hours on desk work for every hour they take to see patients.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/20/key-performance-indicators-december-21?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Crazy to think that one month ago none of us had ever heard of Omicron. Now, it's the most dominant Covid strain in the US, <a href="https://apnews.com/article/omicron-majority-us-cases-833001ef99862bd6ac17935f65c896cf?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">accounting for 73%</a> of US Covid infections last week, the CDC said yesterday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“Quidditch is at a turning point.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Mary Kimball, executive director of US Quidditch, is <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2021/dec/20/us-quidditch-leagues-change-name-jk-rowling?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bullish</a> on the <em>Harry Potter</em> sport’s growth prospects…but first, it needs a new name. Two US quidditch leagues will change the name from Quidditch in order to 1) “distance themselves from the works of JK Rowling,” who they say has anti-trans views and 2) avoid a legal dust-up with Warner Bros., which has trademarked the term Quidditch.<br><br><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>While we’re on the subject…learn how <em>Harry Potter </em>and <em>Lord of the Rings </em>changed the future of Hollywood 20 years ago. (<a href="https://www.theringer.com/movies/2021/12/17/22840267/lord-of-the-rings-harry-potter-anniversaries-fandom-ip-hollywood?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Ringer</a>)</p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CLIMATE CHANGE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/Himalayan-glaciers-melting-alarming-rate?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Himalayan Glaciers Are Rapidly Melting
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/Himalayan-glaciers-melting-alarming-rate?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="A helicopter flies over Khumbu glacier in the Mount Everest region" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/cc42936d7dd74b676ac7d678f2faca1fd007414f-1024x683.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>PRAKASH MATHEMA/AFP via Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When you see news about glaciers in the Brew, you can probably assume it's not because they're multiplying.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Himalayan glaciers, in fact, are melting at an extraordinary rate, according to <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/himalayan-glaciers-are-melting-at-furious-rate-new-study-shows-11639994402?mod=hp_lead_pos11" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new research</a> published on Monday in the journal <em>Scientific Reports</em>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Researchers found that not only are Himalayan glaciers shrinking more rapidly than glaciers in other parts of the world, but also that in the past 40 years, they’ve shrunk 10x faster than they have during the previous 7 centuries.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For the study, researchers looked at satellite images of ~15,000 glaciers in the region, searching for signs of where the ice masses previously existed. They were able to estimate that the amount of glacial ice lost since the Little Ice Age—a period of global cooling between 400 and 700 years ago—has been enough to raise global sea levels about 1/20th of an inch.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it matters: </strong>The Himalayas, sometimes referred to as the “Third Pole,” contain the world’s third-largest amount of glacier ice, and the largest reserve of freshwater outside of the polar regions. The region threatened by the ice melt is the source of 10 major river basins that provide drinking water, irrigation, and power to about 1.9 billion people.—<em>MK</em></p>
</div>

say? Rude passengers refusing to mask up?\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe answer, in fact, is not at all related to Covid: What the industry is most concerned about, Southwest CEO Gary Kelly told senators last week, is the arrival of a \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-12-20/airlines-amp-up-warnings-on-5g-service-see-risk-of-late-flights?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enew 5G wireless service\u003c/a\u003e from AT\u0026T and Verizon on Jan. 5. The aviation sector has been arguing that this launch will interfere with key cockpit systems and lead to major disruptions for travelers in the new year.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUnited Airlines CEO Scott Kirby said that the 5G rollout could delay, divert, or cancel ~4% of daily flights.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe trade group Airlines for America projected 5G-related delays will cost passengers $1.6 billion annually.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhy can’t 5G and cockpits get along?\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAirline execs say 5G signals, which operate in a range of radio frequencies called the C-band, could mess with the cockpit systems that are used to track a plane’s altitude and help with landings in bad weather. So, in a situation where those systems are interfered with by 5G signals and dense fog rolls into Chicago, landings at O’Hare might be deemed unsafe, which would then wreak scheduling havoc across the country.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn response to these concerns, telecom leaders are playing the world’s smallest violin. Wireless companies paid at least $81 billion for the rights to this C-band, and they’re not going to let airline execs ruin their much-hyped push into next-gen wireless networks…\u003cem\u003eespecially\u003c/em\u003e when they consider those concerns unfounded.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“The aviation industry’s fearmongering relies on completely discredited information and deliberate distortions of fact,” Nick Ludlum, senior vice president at wireless trade group CTIA, said.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead…\u003c/strong\u003etelecom and aviation leaders are locked in high-stakes negotiations with the White House and regulators about a deal that would dim 5G signal power near airports. In the meantime, airlines are warily prepping for flight restrictions.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nClassrooms Empty Out...Again\n\u003c/font\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe fourth-grade holiday party just isn't the same from your kitchen table. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe number of US public schools closing due to Covid this week \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-12-20/school-closings-surge-as-omicron-spreads-across-the-u-s?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehit 646\u003c/a\u003e, an increase of 81% from the previous week, according to data service Burbio. The jump comes only days before most schools’ winter breaks were set to begin and as the highly contagious Omicron variant races across the country.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome experts and politicians are urging school districts to keep their doors open. They argue that virtual classrooms are more harmful to students than the risk of developing severe illness from Covid (Covid hospitalizations for school-age children has been 1-in-100,000 throughout the pandemic).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOne report from McKinsey Insights found that online learning left students up to five months behind in math and four months behind in reading. And schools with a majority Black population suffered even more educational setbacks after pivoting to virtual classes.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Health officials are increasingly trying to avoid widespread quarantines for school children. Last Friday, the CDC endorsed a policy known as “\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/12/17/us/politics/unvaccinated-children-covid-testing-cdc.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etest-to-stay\u003c/a\u003e,” which aims to reduce classroom disruptions by allowing students exposed to Covid to get tested and return to school.—\u003cem\u003eMM\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epaying $28.3 billion\u003c/a\u003e to buy electronic medical records company Cerner, because hey, anything that makes paperwork less excruciating seems like a savvy business play in our book.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOracle is known for being aggressive with acquisitions (it even rallied a group to try and buy TikTok last year), but Cerner is Oracle’s biggest purchase in its history. The deal is further evidence that health care is “on par with banking in terms of the importance to our future,” as cofounder Larry Ellison told analysts earlier this month.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn Cerner, Oracle will get the Klay Thompson of the electronic medical records market—a very influential player, but in second place behind Epic, which owns a 31% market share.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eBig tech companies see a \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/12/20/technology/oracle-cerner-health-records.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egolden opportunity\u003c/a\u003e in bringing the health care industry to the cloud, given its size (health care spending accounts for 20% of US GDP), and its old-school record-keeping process. A Mayo Clinic study cited by Oracle showed that doctors and nurses spend an average of 1–2 hours on desk work for every hour they take to see patients.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nHimalayan Glaciers Are Rapidly Melting\n\u003c/font\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/Himalayan-glaciers-melting-alarming-rate?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\u0026uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"A helicopter flies over Khumbu glacier in the Mount Everest region\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/cc42936d7dd74b676ac7d678f2faca1fd007414f-1024x683.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"source\" style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003ePRAKASH MATHEMA/AFP via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen you see news about glaciers in the Brew, you can probably assume it's not because they're multiplying.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHimalayan glaciers, in fact, are melting at an extraordinary rate, according to \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/himalayan-glaciers-are-melting-at-furious-rate-new-study-shows-11639994402?mod=hp_lead_pos11\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enew research\u003c/a\u003e published on Monday in the journal \u003cem\u003eScientific Reports\u003c/em\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eResearchers found that not only are Himalayan glaciers shrinking more rapidly than glaciers in other parts of the world, but also that in the past 40 years, they’ve shrunk 10x faster than they have during the previous 7 centuries.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor the study, researchers looked at satellite images of ~15,000 glaciers in the region, searching for signs of where the ice masses previously existed. They were able to estimate that the amount of glacial ice lost since the Little Ice Age—a period of global cooling between 400 and 700 years ago—has been enough to raise global sea levels about 1/20th of an inch.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it matters: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Himalayas, sometimes referred to as the “Third Pole,” contain the world’s third-largest amount of glacier ice, and the largest reserve of freshwater outside of the polar regions. The region threatened by the ice melt is the source of 10 major river basins that provide drinking water, irrigation, and power to about 1.9 billion
